examples: We've finished our phonemic analysis and we're ready to move on to morphology.

definitions.definition: Relating to a difference between sounds that can change the meaning of words in a language.
Corresponding precisely and consistently with the sounds of the phonemes.
examples: Spanish orthography is highly phonemic : you can tell exactly how the words sound just by looking at how they are spelled.

secondary_definitions: ( linguistics ) Relating to a difference between sounds that can change the meaning of words in a language.
( linguistics , of an orthography [writing system] ) Corresponding precisely and consistently with the sounds of the phonemes.
